titles: A treatise of dreams & visions wherein the causes, natures, and uses, of nocturnal representations, and the communications both of good and evil angels, as also departed souls, to mankind. Are theosophically unfolded; that is according to the Word of God, and the harmony of created beings. To which is added, a discourse of the causes, natures, and cure of phrensie, madness or distraction. By Tho. Tryon, student in physick.
author: Tryon, Thomas, 1634-1703.
notes: With six preliminary contents leaves and two final advertisement leaves..
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
keywords: Dreams --  Religious aspects --  Christianity --  Early works to 1800.
